title: Solution to MB4/MB5 not working in windows creators update!!!
body:
Here's my original post

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/245Audyj-mb4mb5-not-working-after-windows-creators-update


After some more digging I found that the issue was caused by the windows KB4015583 update, which breaks compatibility with certain mouse drivers (Logitech I'm looking at you...).

2 ways to fix this:

1) easier option would be go into your mouse software (in my case logitech options) and change the MB4/MB5 key from back and forward to a keyboard input (in my case I changed MB4 to [ and MB5 to ]), restart your pc and the league client will pick the buttons right up! No need to mess with your updates this way!

2) Open Start Menu > Type "Control Panel" and Open it > Programs and Features > View Installed Updates (Top Left) > Search for KB4015583 > Right Click, Uninstall.

I know the issue is almost a month old now and not technically directly related to league, but I figured I may as well post what I found as I haven't been able to find anyone else with a solution to the issue. So maybe this will help out one or two people that had this problem.

If you'd like a detailed run-down of the update, you can view it here: 
https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/4015583/windows-10-update-kb4015583

It's a few very minor updates to general windows services, nothing that would break anything if uninstalled, and if it does you can always re-download the update with the instructions on the above page.

3) Wait for Microsoft/RITO/Mouse manufacturer to fix this up

Hope this helps!

No need to mess with your updates this way! this is great if you have the deathaddder you can change it in the razor configuator

So I found a solution, which seems to work for me and is actually quite easy, because it doesnt require any windows setbacks!

1) download autohotkey

2) create a .txt-file and insert the following:


SetTitleMatchMode 2
IfWinActive League of Legends (TM) Client
XButton1::[abuttononyourkeyboard1]
XButton2::[abuttononyourkeyboard2]
#If


i chose the buttons numpad4 and numpad6 to replace the buttons on my mouse, so thats my code:


SetTitleMatchMode 2
IfWinActive League of Legends (TM) Client
XButton1::Numpad4
XButton2::Numpad6
#If


3) save that .txt-file and change it to a .ahk-file and doubleclick it to start it up.
4) go to LOL and assign [abuttononyourkeyboard1] and [abuttononyourkeyboard2] as those hotkeys, where you would assign the mouse buttons.
https://gyazo.com/605e7951643a6bd66564f0aa26909451

voila, when your inside LOL only, your mouse will work as usual! In my case I can use my summoner spells again!


edit: here a screenshot of how the line of code should look like: https://gyazo.com/129d4d41a7f9f0eb71902908f993a61c

I solved mine by doing the following

1. Download the mouse test tool above

2. Remove all mouse except the one you have trouble with

3. Open device manager, in the mouse section if you see two mice, disable one

4. If your mouse stopped working, re-enable it using keyboard or replugging

5. Disable the one which won't freeze your mouse

6. Restart the test tool, it should now properly detect it as a 5-button mouse
